intro: Neowilliamsia tenuisulcata, commonly known as the slender-sulcate williamsia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often displaying vibrant colors such as red or purple. Neowilliamsia tenuisulcata is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
